# Task

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is how you can define the function `q_and_a_extractor` using the Julia programming language:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    # Split the text into lines
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    
    question = ""
    answer = ""
    in_question = false
    in_answer = false
    
    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "# Question")
            in_question = true
            in_answer = false
        elseif startswith(line, "# Answer")
            in_question = false
            in_answer = true
        end
        
        # Extract text within the sections
        if in_question && !isempty(strip(line))
            question *= strip(line[13:end])*"\n" 
        elseif in_answer && !isempty(strip(line))
            answer *= strip(line[10:end])*"\n" 
        end
    end
    
    return (question, answer)
end
```
This function works by iterating over each line of the markdown text. If it encounters a line that starts with "# Question", it switches to capturing question text. Similarly if it encounters a line that starts with "# Answer", it switches to capturing answer text. All other lines are ignored.
